title: 00165 Ram Upgrade
message: Is it possible to upgrade 00165/00164 to 16gb ram?  I've been done 8gb but these days on newer os they are running pretty slow.  I have a 4gb 00165that customer sold to me instead of fixing and wanted to upgrade to 16gb if possible.  If it can which ram type do i need?

title: 00165 Ram Upgrade
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?q=a1466+8gb+ram+upgrade&client=firefox-b-d&bih=615&biw=1408&hl=es&ei=zMSnYua-OIjuaKvCkagC&ved=0ahUKEwjm1L-Vx6v4AhUINxoKHSthBCUQ4dUDCA0&uact=5&oq=a1466+8gb+ram+upgrade&gs_lcp=Cgdnd3Mtd2l6EAM6BAgAEEdKBAhBGABKBAhGGABQ0RZY9x5goCNoAHACeACAAX2IAeMBkgEDMC4ymAEAoAEByAEIwAEB&sclient=gws-wiz[/URL]
You have some videos in the first results...

title: 00165 Ram Upgrade
message:
there were plenty of 8gb ram upgrades but that wasn't what i was looking for.  i wanted 16gb ram upgrade.  i only found one guy who did it on youtube which is why i asked the quesiton. Anyways, i think i ordered the correct ram (not sure becuase the video wasn't that high quality) and followed the same resistor swap.  now am getting beeps on startup.

Ram i ordered: [URL]https://www.ebay.com/itm/313627948809?ssPageName=STRK%3AMEBIDX%3AIT&_trksid=p2060353.m2749.l2649[/URL]
video i followed: [MEDIA=youtube]RgEfMzMxX5E[/MEDIA]

again, if you could help me out i would very much appreciate it.

title: 00165 Ram Upgrade
message:
There are 4 lines to configure RAM capacity and brand, XDP_MLB_RAMCFG0-3.
R1611/35/36/31 are the pull-up resistors.
R2053/52/51/50 are the pull-down resistors.
The guy from that video only switched CFG3 to 1 (high level) from 0.
The other 3 lines depends of his original configuration.
If you had different chips on the MLB (than him), then need to play with CFG0-2 configuration.
That means 8 options possible.

I extracted 8GB configuration from other video:
- HYNIX        0010
- SAMSUNG    0110    K4E6E304EE-EGCE
- ELPIDA    1110
- MICRON    1010

If you get it working with 16GB, then post full configuration.
